text:
The fund for Charlie Gard has reached ÂŁ400,000 (Picture: PA) A couple’s appeal for help raising cash for their sick baby son has become one of the biggest campaigns of its kind.
Postman Chris Gard and Connie Yates, of Bedfont, west London, want to raise ÂŁ1.2 million to fund treatment in America for seven-month-old son Charlie.
They have launched an appeal on the GoFundMe website and raised more than ÂŁ400,000. But they have just two weeks to raise ÂŁ800,000.
A GoFundMe spokesman said only two campaigns have raised more in the two years it has operated in the UK.
Specialists at Great Ormond Street Hospital in London say it is time to stop providing life-support treatment to Charlie, who was born on August 4.
Doctors say Charlie, who suffers from a rare genetic condition, should move to a palliative care regime, but his parents, in their early 30s, want to be allowed to take him to a hospital in the US where they hope he will be treated.
A judge is due to analyse the case at a hearing in the Family Division of the High Court in early April, and decide what is in Charlie’s best interests.
His parents say they need to hit their target by April 3.
More than 17,000 donations have been offered, the website shows, including two anonymous pledges of ÂŁ20,000, one for ÂŁ10,000 and two of ÂŁ5,000.
